title: Drawing, "Sketches for decorated ceilings and friezes", ca. 1813
medium: Black chalk, pen and black ink, brush and brown watercolor, graphite on cream laid paper
markings: In purple ink, upper right: Cooper Union stamp: MUSEUM / FOR THE / ARTS OF / DECORATION / COOPER UNION (Lugt 457c)
inscribed: Inscribed in black ink, upper margin: 22
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: A road passes a gorge. A Madonna shrine is fixed to a trunk of a tree. A man with a cart on the road. Framing line, caption: “la Strada di Caprarola,” above: “22”. On verso: two sketches for vaulted ceilings, three decorated panels and friezes and moldings. Friezes showing festoons, candelabra and winged genii; putti ride upon festoons; putti riding upon sea monsters. Numbered “23.”

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Sketches for decorated ceilings and friezes", ca. 1813.Black chalk, pen and black ink, brush and brown watercolor, graphite on cream laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-2087.
